name: Bronchitis
symptoms: cough with mucus, chest discomfort, fatigue
recommendation: Rest, stay hydrated, and use bronchodilators or antibiotics if bacterial.

name: Peptic Ulcer
recommendation: Use antacids, avoid NSAIDs, and treat H. pylori if present.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
symptoms: burning sensation during urination, frequent urge to urinate
recommendation: Use prescribed antibiotics and drink plenty of fluids.

name: Hepatitis B
recommendation: Antiviral medication if chronic, avoid alcohol, and monitor liver function.

name: Measles
recommendation: Supportive care, isolate patient, and ensure vaccination.
medicine: Paracetamol, Vitamin A, oral rehydration salts

name: Chickenpox
recommendation: Rest, avoid scratching, and use antivirals if severe.

name: Meningitis
recommendation: Hospitalization and treatment with antibiotics or antivirals.

name: Tonsillitis
symptoms: sore throat, swollen tonsils, difficulty swallowing
recommendation: Use antibiotics if bacterial and manage pain with supportive care.

name: Scabies
symptoms: intense itching, skin rash with burrows
recommendation: Apply prescribed scabicide cream and wash clothing in hot water.

name: Ringworm
symptoms: itchy, circular red rash on skin
recommendation: Use antifungal creams or oral medication.

name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
recommendation: Maintain hygiene, use antibiotic drops if bacterial, and avoid touching eyes.

name: Otitis Media
recommendation: Use pain relievers, antibiotics if bacterial, and monitor for complications.

name: Gastroenteritis
recommendation: Rehydrate, rest, and use antibiotics only if bacterial.

name: Rheumatic Fever
symptoms: fever, joint pain, rash, heart inflammation
recommendation: Use antibiotics and anti-inflammatory drugs, monitor heart health.

name: Migraine
symptoms: throbbing headache, nausea, sensitivity to light
recommendation: Avoid triggers, use prescribed pain relievers or preventive medications.

name: Epilepsy
recommendation: Use antiepileptic drugs, avoid seizure triggers, and regular follow-up.

name: Depression
symptoms: persistent sadness, fatigue, loss of interest
recommendation: Therapy, antidepressant medication, support groups.

name: Anxiety Disorder
recommendation: Cognitive-behavioral therapy, relaxation techniques, medication if needed.

name: Anemia
recommendation: Iron supplements, dietary changes, treat underlying causes.
medicine: Ferrous sulfate, Folic acid, Vitamin B12

name: Goiter
recommendation: Iodine supplementation, thyroid hormone therapy, surgery if large.

name: Hypertension
recommendation: Reduce salt intake, exercise daily, and take antihypertensive medication as prescribed.

name: Diabetes Mellitus
symptoms: frequent urination, increased thirst, unexplained weight loss
recommendation: Maintain a balanced diet, exercise regularly, monitor blood sugar, and take insulin or oral medications.

name: Asthma
symptoms: shortness of breath, wheezing, chest tightness
recommendation: Avoid triggers, use inhalers as prescribed, and monitor symptoms.

name: Malaria
recommendation: Take antimalarial medications and use mosquito nets.

name: Pneumonia
recommendation: Use antibiotics as prescribed, rest, and stay hydrated.

name: Tuberculosis
symptoms: persistent cough, weight loss, night sweats, fever
recommendation: Take a full course of anti-TB drugs as prescribed.

name: HIV/AIDS
recommendation: Start and adhere to antiretroviral therapy (ART).

name: COVID-19
symptoms: fever, cough, loss of taste or smell, fatigue
recommendation: Isolate, take supportive care, and follow medical advice.
medicine: Paracetamol, Azithromycin (if bacterial infection), Dexamethasone (if severe)

name: Dysentery
recommendation: Maintain hygiene, drink clean water, and use antibiotics if bacterial.

name: Typhoid Fever
symptoms: high fever, weakness, stomach pain, constipation or diarrhea
recommendation: Use antibiotics as prescribed, rest, and hydrate.

name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs, eat smaller meals, and take acid-reducing medication.

name: Gastroenteritis
recommendation: Stay hydrated and use antidiarrheals if needed.

name: Hepatitis B
recommendation: Avoid alcohol, monitor liver health, and take antivirals if necessary.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
symptoms: burning urination, frequent urge to urinate, cloudy urine
recommendation: Increase fluid intake and complete antibiotic course.

name: Meningitis
symptoms: fever, stiff neck, sensitivity to light, headache
recommendation: Immediate hospitalization and antibiotics or antivirals.

name: Otitis Media
recommendation: Pain management and antibiotics if bacterial.

name: Bronchitis
symptoms: persistent cough, chest discomfort, mucus production
recommendation: Rest, stay hydrated, and use cough suppressants.

name: Conjunctivitis
symptoms: redness in the eye, itching, discharge
recommendation: Maintain eye hygiene and use eye drops.
medicine: Chloramphenicol eye drops, Lubricant eye drops

name: Scabies
recommendation: Apply scabicidal cream and wash clothes in hot water.

name: Ringworm
recommendation: Use antifungal cream and maintain hygiene.

name: Measles
recommendation: Supportive care and vaccination for prevention.

name: Chickenpox
recommendation: Isolate, soothe itching, and take antivirals if severe.

name: Tonsillitis
symptoms: sore throat, swollen tonsils, difficulty swallowing
recommendation: Rest, drink warm fluids, and use antibiotics if bacterial.

name: Anemia
symptoms: fatigue, pale skin, shortness of breath
recommendation: Eat iron-rich foods and take supplements.
medicine: Ferrous sulfate, Folic acid, Vitamin B12

name: Migraine
symptoms: throbbing headache, nausea, sensitivity to light
recommendation: Avoid triggers and use migraine-specific medication.

name: Gallstones
recommendation: Low-fat diet and surgery if symptomatic.

name: Appendicitis
recommendation: Surgical removal of appendix (appendectomy).

name: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease
symptoms: lower abdominal pain, fever, abnormal discharge
recommendation: Complete full antibiotic course.

name: Depression
symptoms: persistent sadness, loss of interest, fatigue
recommendation: Therapy and medications if needed.

name: Epilepsy
recommendation: Take antiepileptic drugs regularly and avoid triggers.
